revised_title: On the Structure and Development of the Nervous and Circulatory Systems in Myriapoda and Arachnida
tldr: The author, George Newport, examines the structure and development of the nervous and circulatory systems in Myriapoda and Arachnida. He describes the different forms of the nervous system in various genera and discusses the function of the ganglia as centers of growth, nourishment, and reflex movements. Additionally, Newport explores the circulatory system, focusing on the heart and blood vessels, and their role in distributing blood throughout the body.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Comparative Anatomy
